SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Allopurinol is a frequently prescribed drug

In inflammatory bowel disease patients who shunt thiopurine metabolism towards more toxic and less desirable pathways, allopurinol is proving to be an effective add on therapy with good resultant disease control and less treatment side effects
As many such patients are young, the potential for pregnant women to be exposed to allopurinol is increasing
The safety of allopurinol in pregnancy is not known however
CASE PRESENTATION: We report three cases of safe use of allopurinol in pregnancy for women with inflammatory bowel disease
This included 2 patients with ulcerative colitis and 1 patient with fistulising Crohn's disease
Allopurinol was used throughout pregnancy in all patients
All 3 pregnancies resulted in normal healthy babies born at term by Caesarean section
CONCLUSION: It is important to evaluate and document the safety of allopurinol during pregnancy, as it is finding new roles in young patients
These three cases add significantly to the very limited data on allopurinol use in pregnancy
We encourage reporting of all cases of allopurinol use in pregnant patients and suggest an allopurinol pregnancy registry to document drug exposures and outcomes
